doc.wiki: A software company is a company whose primary products are various forms of software, software technology, distribution, and software product development.[1] They make up the software industry. There are a number of different types of software companies: All of these may be categorized in one or many of the following:[2] Organizing a software company is very specialized type of management skill, where experienced persons can turn the organizational problem into a unique benefit. For example, having sub-teams spread in different time zones may allow a 24-hour company working day, if the teams, systems and procedures are well established. A good example is the test team in time zone 8 hours ahead or behind the development team, who fix software bugs found by the testers.
